data.title: Elizabeth Nicholson 1835
data.text:
Have you got her marriage certificate?

The name of her father could be on there, or a family member could have been a witness.

Researching:

My brother, photo taken in September 1991 just a couple of weeks before he died. ............................................................ To help us and to get better results, please post as much detail as you can, especially name, date(s) and place. Also say what you already know.

Are you SURE that Elizabeth Nicholson married Benjamin Furness????

This is the only marriage showing up on Freebmd .................. and Elizabeth would have been only 5 years old!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Marriages Sep 1840 (>99%)

ATKINSON Hannah Whitehaven 25 131

FURNESS Benjamin Whitehaven 25 131

MILES Ann Whitehaven 25 131

NICHOLSON Elizabeth Whitehaven 25 131

NICHOLSON James Whitehaven 25 131

PROBART Sarah Whitehaven 25 131

Researching:

My brother, photo taken in September 1991 just a couple of weeks before he died. ............................................................ To help us and to get better results, please post as much detail as you can, especially name, date(s) and place. Also say what you already know.

In 1861 census he is 28 and Elizabeth 25 thank you I will see if her name was Nicholson maybe I have got it wrong

Joseph Furness was born ca 1869, registered in Cockermouth, the registration district that includes Camerton

BUT his mmn is Dover according to the GRO Index

FURNESS, JOSEPH mmn DOVER Order

GRO Reference: 1869 M Quarter in COCKERMOUTH Volume 10B Page 525

I can't see a marraige for aBenjamin Furness to an Elizabeth Dover, there is a marriage of a Benjamin Fpossibly to an Elizabeth Hanson in Halifax in 1871

Marriages Dec 1871 (>99%)

COCKCROFT Charles William Halifax 9a 838

Furness Benjamin Halifax 9a 838

Gledhill Ruth Halifax 9a 838 Scan

Hanson Elizabeth Halifax 9a 838

Is there any possibility that Elizabeth Dover might have married a Mr Nicholson, left him and moved in with Benjamin.

That would account for no marriage being found.

This looks like Elizabeth in 1851 .................... "Perton" looks more like Seaton on the image!

'Morning Sylvia.......

Yes, that's what I had found too.

I also found that Joseph Dover had probably died in 1949 and that Mary Dover was living with her aunt + uncle but couldn't see any trace of Arabella.

I wondered if she had remarried, perhaps accounting for the 'Nicholson' name ? but couldn't find anything.
